results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 014
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Opal mining at Lightning Ridge. Shows where the stones are found, how they are mined and how they are readied for setting. Hobart Regatta: the march past, the yachts on the Derwent river and the first division race.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 012
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Of great strategic and commercial value are the Cocos (Keeling) Islands, 1700 miles north-west of Perth providing an air-link between Australia and South Africa. The pleasant climate encourages outdoor life and sport of all kinds flourishes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian [colour] Diary. No. 11
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. Tony Rasky, caricaturist, gives some impressions of famous sporting personalities - Lew Hoad, Herb Elliot, Peter Thompson. 2. Wellington airport, another ground link in the airways of the sky, opens with a spectacular display of flying, and exhibition of aircraft.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 010
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Ancient art of the potter used in manufacture of plastic lampshades; Taree’s attractions include facilities for yachting, golf, bowls; valuable minerals such as rutile and zircon; scenery, forestry and cattle industry. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian Army at war
results.brief_description: A film telling the story of the Australian Army’s part in the fighting on world battle fronts, from the outbreak of war in 1939 until the surrender of Japan. It depicts the background of the Australian soldier, recruiting and training, embarkation scenes, a coverage of major campaigns, surrender ceremonies, release of prisoners of war and demobilization. No other credits available.

results.title: Australia makes aircraft
results.creator_credit: Richard Mitchell, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Department of Supply is the centre of the Australian aircraft industry. Film shows the manufacture of military aircraft in Australia. Includes production and assembly of a Mirage supersonic fighter and its Atar engine and shows briefly the design, testing and maintenance facilities of the department.

results.title: Australia, land of everchange
results.brief_description: Displays the infinite variety of the vast Australian continent - its snow fields and tropic reefs, its mountains and plains, its city life and agriculture, its indigenous peoples and advanced civilization, its unique native animals and notable farm stock.
